Yes but we dont have to hide and sneak around like the good old days when p=

y expensive equipment to be taken seriously. 35 mm was my camera of choice =
for many man years. cassette tape was as good as it got for audio thyen vhs=
 cameras came in but low light slowed things down with them till the advent=
 of fancy new fangled night vision and so forth the old infra red was as go=
od as it got 30-40 years ago. god I am getting old.LOL

It is truly ironic that pa=
rt of my professional background and training happens to be in broadcast pr=
oduction. So I am intimately aware of what it takes to produce and distribu=
te television programs and why and how this is done. I concur completely th=
at it is inaccurate to view these shows as "reality". They are of course "e=
ntertainment. " (Actually they have their own classification which came int=
o being a few years ago.)
=A0
What is troubling, perhaps only to me because=
 of my background, is that such shows have come to represent to the public =
the state of affairs in this and related fields. The more investment there =
the more this is obvious.

<DIV>
<DIV>It is truly ironic that part of my professional background and training happens to be in broadcast production. So I am intimately aware of what it takes to produce and distribute television programs and why and how this is done. I concur completely that it is inaccurate to view these shows as "reality". They are of course "entertainment. " (Actually they have their own classification which came into being a few years ago.)</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>What is troubling, perhaps only to me because of my background, is that such shows have come to represent to the public the state of affairs in this and related fields. The more investment there the more this is obvious.</DIV></DIV></DIV><BR></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></td></tr></table><br>
